data.name: Fix Android Crashing from spread out logins

description.body:
As an [ FFRS User ]

I want to [ be able to log into Multiple Devices ],

but I can't because [ Active911 ties a login to a specific device ].

Explore fixes for this:

In FFRS, a member can log in to multiple devices under the same login email address.  As each member is a DEVICE in Active, when there are members that log in to more than one device it is causing crashes.  Everyone that has not done that in a brigade is not having crashed (this is true with Android).

data.name: Better GCM diagnostics

description.body:
As an [ Active911 Employee ]

I want to [ have better GCM logging and metrics ],

so that I can [ know when GCM is not working and find root causes more easily ].

FROM RM #2026

We need to come up with a system of Metrics to monitor the number of users affected by poor GCM messaging, GCM disconnects and unsent messages that are reportedly being sent by us. We need some baseline of how many android people are experiencing GCM failures by monitoring it somehow. Come up with how we want to come up with that monitoring and statistics.

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1uZM_flkdrcRrf00LnxMjnzwJLJQMGX6mHnJj1kLtzs0/edit

data.name: Wiz has a problem finding street name "RR 12"

description.body:
As a [ User ]

I want to [ get accurate GPS data from my county ],

but I can't because [ Wiz cannot find certain addresses in my data ].

Problem with uploading.  Similar street names are unable to be added after the first one.

http://wiz.active911.com/geocode/json?country=us&region=TX&city=Dripping%20Springs&address=28717%20RR%2012
        I still get error: "Unable to find any street named 'RR 12'" .  However, that address is entry
        14079 of our 73546 entry NHFD_addrpoints.dbf file which is the same file supplied to you.
        This entry looks very similar to our addrpoints file entry 33524 which was used for the
        "exact" match in experiment above.
        Note I also tried with Rr12, Ranch Road 12, and RM 12 and received same result.

data.name: Refactoring access_server web_api to keep core functionality of webview up to date

description.body:
web_api.php was feature frozen and wasn't refactored into the common api. Because of this we have noticed one major difference in functionality for webview in OTRS ticket #2017021610000489 - alert daisychaining / pagegroup forwarding doesn't work for alerts that originate on webview.

This aha idea is to address potential current differences and others that will be introduced when we make further code changes to the common api.

An important first (high-priority) target is to do enough refactoring so that web_api can use the common api's version of the send_alert function.

 

Test Cases

   Shared Api Operations continue to work.

      Expected Outcome: The output of all shared operations are the same as before on all clients (iOS, Android, Windows, Webview).

      Steps to test: Perform each shared operation against each clients endpoint before and after the change.

      Why this is a concern: There might be an accidental change the causes problems.

 Didn't run these tests - No changes were made to ApiCommon

 

   Webview continues to work as expected.

      Expected Outcome: All webview interactions continue to work.

      Steps to test: Test all webview features in your browser.

      Why is this a concern: There might be breaking changes that were not noticed.

Manually tested each of the features tied to the access api calls that were changed. Found and fixed a couple of bugs. Should be ready for QA.

Check the docker logs for any error messages.

Test - Create a template using keys that exist. Run the generation script with the template and English language as input.

Expected Outcome - The template will contain the keys replaced with their values in English

Test - Create a template using keys that exist and have values in all other languages defined. Run the generation script once for each language with the template and language as input.

Expected Outcome - The template will contain the keys replaced with their values in input language

Test - Create a template using keys that exist but don't have a value in a certain language. Run the generation script with the template and language as input.

Expected Outcome - The template will contain the keys replaced with their values in English

Test - Create a template using keys that don't exist. Run the generation script with the template and English language as input.

Expected Outcome - The script will return an error with a list of keys that could not be found in the JSON file.

data.name: Scope Clients Automatically downloading new Icons & colors

description.body:
Determine the requisite steps to handle this user story:

As a [ Developer ],

I want to [ add additional map icon types without a client update ],

so that [ I can add additional icons without adjusting every client ]

Deliverable is a high level design document on how we should handle this.

 

Considerations:

Will icon/color updates be pushed or pulled?

What will markers look like when there's no icon available?

How often will the clients update their icons?

requirements.name: We need a handle on Metadata without adding columns to the table every time.

description.body:
There are some logical groupings we can perform of our map data like:

icon type - (water source, hazards, sensors, events, locations, staging areas)

active911 type - (device, location)

source - (where the data came from)

icon visibility - (Height at which this icon is visible by default), see Feat 101

description -

height -

width -

 

We want the values of these types to be extensible without requiring updates on the clients.

requirements.name: The high level architecture needs to be flexible enough to apply elsewhere

description.body:
We should be able to apply this same design to other areas such as:

  • Ringtones
  • Icon Colors (various standards)
  • Permissions
  • user metadata

data.name: Replace HAProxy with NGINX

description.body:
As a [ Developer ]

I want to change [ the proxy we are using ] in [ the swarm ],

so that I can [ have a reliable proxy container that does it's job without breaking ].

 

Test Cases

   All HTTP Traffic works correctly

      Expected Outcome: All HTTP endpoints are able to be hit and continue to work as expected. (alert, access, www, webview, interface,...)

      Steps to test: When connecting over HTTP via a subdomain, does the web page load as expected?

      Why this is a concern: It is a core feature.

   All SMTP Traffic works correctly

      Expected Outcome: After sending an email to a subdomain, it is received and an alert is sent.

      Steps to test: Send an smtp email to a subdomain that the proxy is listening on and see if the alert server logs report that an email was received.

      Why this is a concern: It is a core feature.

   All SNPP Traffic works correctly

      Expected Outcome: After sending an snpp alert to a subdomain, it is received and an alert is sent.

      Steps to test: Send an snpp alert to a subdomain that the proxy is listening on and see if the alert server logs report that an snpp alert was received.

      Why this is a concern: It is a core feature.

   All XMPP Traffic works correctly

      Expected Outcome: A client can connect to an XMPP chatroom on a subdomain that the proxy is listening on.

      Steps to test: Use an XMPP client to connect to a subdomain that the proxy is listening on and see if you connect successfully.

      Why this is a concern: It is a core feature.

data.name: Fix APNSD to work in both a swarm and production

description.body:
As a [ Developer ]

I want to [ fix APNSD to allow the same code to run in swarm and non swarm mode ],

so that I can [ stop worrying about which branch to deploy ].

Test Plan:

Expected Outcome: Send messages to iOS devices both when running on the swarm and in prod, using the same code.

Steps to Test: Push the APNSD code to the swarm and to the beta prod server. Then make sure alerts can be sent to iOS devices through both.

Why this is a Concern: Using different code for prod and the swarm is bad practice, and leads to unexpected behavior.

description.body: Bringing Docker to Active911 should eliminate the complexity in deploying code, significantly increase the speed of development by reducing friction in the development cycle, and increase confidence in the deployed code works as expected.

data.name: Update GCM play services

description.body:
As a [ user ]

I want to [ stay connected to Google Play Services ],

so that I can [ get the calls I need when I need them ].

 

From RM #2174

The play services versions we rely on in the android app is very out of date. This may be causing GMS issues for some users. To update we need to replace the getMap() function in the GoogleMapFragment with getMapAsync(callback). This requires a minor rewrite of some logic to work asynchronously. Possibly related to this ticket:

http://ticket.active911.com/otrs/index.pl?Action=AgentTicketZoom;TicketID=120297#399196

data.name: Android - Apply filters to the response list.

description.body:
As a [ User ]

I want to [ the responses sorted by response type ],

so that I can [ find the responders efficiently ].

Test Cases

New Response Order

Expected Outcome: The new response should be ordered in the correct stop.

Steps to test: When an new response is received, does it show up in the correct place in order?

Why this is a concern: This would be a problem if responses are only sorted when they are initially drawn or fetched.

Changing Response Filter

Expected Outcome: The list of responders reorders correctly based on their most recent response.

Steps to test: When the user changes the ordering filter, do the devices reorder to the desired order?

Why is this a concern: It tests the basic feature.
Sort the alarm responders list by responding, not responding, name, location, etc.

data.name: Google Map in iOS crashes with too many markers on screen

description.body:
The error message from xcode is: "Reached the max number of texture atlases, can not allocate more."

This is an issue/limitation with how we are using the Google Maps SDK (too many unique GMSMarker/UIImages). Prior to reaching the limit (crash), performance also diminishes greatly (down to ~1-5 fps).

Also worth noting, looking at the available crash reports for iOS, this is currently the #1 cause of crashes, with 643 in the past 2 weeks (#2 coming in at 111). So that should provide a pretty good incentive for expediting this one.

TODO
While working on this bug, first try to recreate it in a testing env, by creating 100+ unique markers in a loop within the mapviewcontroller. From my init research, you should try to do this with devices instead of locations, with unique icons/callouts/text.

data.name: Missing responses on iOS

description.body:
The problem happens when we fetch an alert via get all volatile data. If the alert doesn't already exist on the device (fetch wasn't triggered during APN), the responses are applied before the the alerts finish downloading.

1a. deviceHasUnreadMessages -> async -> 1b.fetchAlertUsingMessageID

2. updateAlertResponses

1b ends up happening before 2 and so the fetched alerts are missing these responses.

Run "steps to reproduce" debug the above function calls to get a more detailed view of the problem.

 

Test Plan - Missing Responses on iOS

Expected Outcome: The alert from device 2 should display on the Response page of the app on device 1.

Step to test: 

Send an alert to a backgrounded device (device 1).

Respond to the alert from another device (device 2) on the same agency.

Put device 1 back in foreground to trigger a "get all volatile data" call.

data.name: Outline design pattern for making sure our services don't keep database connections open for too long

description.body:
If anything on the alert server takes longer than we expect it to, it keeps the database connection open. Single point of failure, DB accepts max of 800 connections, a rouge service can gobble those up very quickly and lock things up.

50% between access, 50% alert server. alert server is easier.

description.body:
“Reject()” is not a function (APNS.js line 107/108)

[2017-05-26T21:04:09.795Z] INFO: messy/3594 on Jasons-Air.pro-flightaviat.local: Sending: {"alert":{"title":"Message Title","body":"This is the message body","action-loc-key":"PLAY"}} to b26ef87e 35a9c9d8 7274d7ba 4f701b39 f38a7ce2 79dbb74f c055acb5 8c628c0b

data.name: As [ Bryan, the Product Manager ] I want to [ have a 80% (B) or higher grade on ssllab's ssl test of our access servers with action items to get us to A's ], so that [ active911 reduces our risk of being impacted by known infrastructure flaws ].

description.body:
[ Bryan ] I don't like our access servers getting a failing grade.  It exposes elements of risk we don't want, so lets get them up to par.


[ Robert ] Our Access Servers are vulnerable to security attacks.

Running a free security test at www.ssllabs.com/ssltest on access.active911.com gives two of our servers an F rating and one of them a C rating.

We are vulnerable to an attack called POODLE which makes sslv3 completely insecure.

The results of this test can be viewed here:

https://www.ssllabs.com/ssltest/analyze.html?d=access.active911.com

requirements.name: Update the current servers to match the one with a B

data.name: As [ Pat Fitzpatrick, an Android User ] I want to [ see how many unread calls I have in Active911 before its open ], so that I can [ know if I've unexpectedly missed an alert ].

description.body:
[ Bryan ] a simple counter for unread messages however the default is set to indicate unread messages.

 

Acceptance Tests:

  • When I have the option enabled [ Android users, help me out here, hows that work? ], I can see the total of unread messages.
  • When I have the Badge App Icon disabled [ Android users, help me out here, hows that work? ], I cannot see the total of unread messages
  • If I get a notification and do not open the app, the number should increment up without opening the app.
  • If I get a notification and open the notification, the number should remain the same when I leave the app.
  • If I read unread messages from the app, the number should decrease by the same number when I leave the app.

data.name: As [ a Support Tech ] I want to [ be able to see alerts I have received notifications for ], but I can't because [ it sometimes takes minutes to load my alerts from the main screen ].

description.body:
[ Jon ] Messages for agencies I am not longer a part of still appear in volatile_data

When I am removed from an agency, I can no longer download the unread_messages for that agency.

The unread_messages still show up in my get_all_volatile_data, causing my app to try to download them everytime I open the app.

This causes lag if I have a lot of unread messages.

Update the query for get_all_volatile_data so that it doesn't get unread_messages which are for agencies I am no longer a part of.

As [ a Support Tech ] I noticed [ that it would sometimes take minutes to load my previous alerts during QA ], which is unacceptable because [ we have a standard of excellence to maintain ].

data.name: Add new status to the access server for iOS geofencing

description.body: Would like to see a feature that would send alerts to my device only if the call for service was a certain radius from my location. In other words I'm out and about and I don't want an alert on every single call within out 654 square mile county, but a CPR comes out a few blocks from my location, I want to be alerted. I could see this as a user defined switch that would allow the user to turn on this feature on/off (due to potential battery drain). It could also be integrated as one of the on/off duty options. Maybe I'm on shift and I want to set it to 7a-7p today. The next day I'm off and want to set it to geofence only. Would also like the radius to be user defined.

data.name: As [ David, a Webview User ] I want to [ have my webview consistently and reliably connected ], so that I can [ have the information without needing to sit and reload the page.  Delays cost lives in my line of work ].

description.body:
[User] From Ticket#2017061410000431

David called in with Comcast techs present at his location. They were
monitoring their connection and said there were no issues with dropped
packets, the firewall was disabled, and no ports were being blocked.

He can connect for a while, and then it disconnects and won't reconnect
without refreshing the page.

We have seen this before, but we can't reliably replicate it. David has
Webview running on a Mac using Chrome.

[ Alex ]

I spoke with Jon about this yesterday, and we decided that even if we spent time trying to recreate this issue we probably wouldn't be able to get it to happen. We have the customer screenshots of the problem which I added in a comment so we know that it's happening, and they already ran through the normal troubleshooting steps of checking their internet connection and ports

At this point it would probably be easiest to implement a catchall solution like refreshing the page if the reconnect fails some number of times

Acceptance Tests:

  • If webview reconnects 6 times over a 3 minute period(~once every 30 seconds over a rolling 3 minutes), the page should automatically reload.
  • Anything less than that should not trigger a reload

data.name: As [ Blaine Howell, an Android User ] I want to [ use the Android App without it constantly asking me for permission to access location and storage ], so that I can [ use the app as I have in the past ].

description.body:
Android app is asking for "Allow Active911 to access photos, media, and files on your device?" & "Allow Active911 to access this device's location?" every time they get a call.

User is using:

HTC One, Android 6.0, and Active911 version 1.5.7.5.

 

[ Acceptance Tests ]

  • Does the permission window not show up on the app if permission was previously given to access photos, media, files, and location on your device?
  • If the window does not show up, does the map display the correct location of the device?
  • If the window does not show up, does the device have access to Active911 ringtones?
  • If the app is uninstalled and reinstalled, does the app ask for these permissions again?

data.name: Log 500 errors from google as unsent messages

description.body:
As [ Support ]

I want to [ find GCM messages that were sent unsuccessfully ],

but I can't because [ our server is not properly logging 500 errors from GCM as unsent ].

 

From RM #1677

Currently if we get a 500 error from google when sending GCM, it doesn't retry and it doesn't insert those messages into the messages table as failed. All that happens is some HTML goes in the log file (see attached URL), and the user doesn't get their alert. We need to at least put the messages in the DB as failed, and probably retry them.

http://alert1-tx.active911.com/webservice/alert/00-16-91-0-201603-1457585606192/log.txt

data.name: log GCM error 401 as unsuccessful in the messages table

description.body:
As [ Support ]

I want to [ log GCM 401 errors in the messages table ],

so that I can [ determine if a message was successfully sent when asked ].

 

From RM #2130

First record of this problem that I'm aware of: OTRS ticket 2016121610000293.

Searching logs from alerts from the same time period it looks like we've experienced intermittent issues (a couple of > 10 second periods of downtime) where google's gcm service returns the following error message to the alert server:

2016-12-15 18:02:01.381 info Sending queued GCM with 27 recipients
2016-12-15 18:02:07.552 error Error sending batch queued GCM messages: Error sending GCM message: HTTP 401 response (

Unauthorized


Unauthorized
Error 401


)

Suggestions from the other redmine ticket:
Handle this response error code by retrying after a delay (since so far this seems to be an intermittent issue)
and adding error entries to the messages table so that we can better track this issue.

As for as diagnosing the root cause, there's nothing that I can think of on our end that would be changing in between these successes/failures (using the same api key, ip address, etc.) so I'm leaning towards external causes -> i.e. I’ve seen reports of increased issues (similar to this one) one since GCM was deprecated. A few people had success with regenerating the GCM keys, others did not. Others reported that switching to FCM fixed these types of issues.

Send an alert to just BryanW-iOS

data.name: As [ a User with ol'e Trusty, my Ancient and Indestructible Phone that will NEVER break on me, ] I want to [ get SMS text messages from real phone numbers ], so that I can [ use Active911 with tools I trust ].

description.body:
[ Jon ]

As [a SMS user on a carrier that doesn't support shortcodes] I want to [receive SMS messages] so that I can [be notified of alerts from my agency]

As [Tyler, a support tech] I want to [change the DID we use to send SMS messages for an agency] so that I can [fix agencies who have members on carriers that don't support shortcode]

Right now, the alert server is hard-coded for all US agencies to send using shortcode. This has been in place since before the great Alert Server Refactor of 2014.

I suggest we change all US agencies to have the shortcode DID, since that is effectively what we are doing now, and then change the alert-server to use that field, the same way we use that field for Canadian agencies.

Acceptance Tests:

  • By default, I get an SMS from our shortcode
  • When I change the agencies DID, I get an SMS from somewhere else

goals.name: Violently React to Bugs that impair our Heroes

data.name: As [ Bryan, the PM ] I want to [ get the work already written for geofencing on the alert server merged ], so that I can [ start getting people testing geofencing ].

description.body:
[ Bryan ] Add filter to alert server for geofenced status

Paul was the last one to touch this branch that remains un-merged in develop. We need to check his code to make sure it is solid and fix where needed to be able to roll this on the next alert sever release.

Acceptance Tests:

  • On Duty for a device works as expected
  • Off Duty for a device works as expected
  • On Duty filters work as expected
  • Off Duty filters work as expected
  • When I set my duty status to "Off duty, but available", I should get an alert within 5 miles of my position.
  • When I have my duty status as "Off Duty, but available", I should not get an alert outside of a 5 mile radius.

Would like to see a feature that would send alerts to my device only if the call for service was a certain radius from my location. In other words I'm out and about and I don't want an alert on every single call within out 654 square mile county, but a CPR comes out a few blocks from my location, I want to be alerted. I could see this as a user defined switch that would allow the user to turn on this feature on/off (due to potential battery drain). It could also be integrated as one of the on/off duty options. Maybe I'm on shift and I want to set it to 7a-7p today. The next day I'm off and want to set it to geofence only. Would also like the radius to be user defined.

data.name: As [ a Product Manager ] I want to [ fix any security loopholes we know about in iOS ], so that I can [ be confident we are securing the app to the best of our knowledge ].

description.body:
We entered into a partnership with Kryptowire and Apco to do a security review of our applications. They found one significant problem that they would like us to address. I've attached the original doc, linked the significant text and urls.

From Kryptowire:

iOS's Application Transport Security feature disabled
We investigate the iOS application's manifest to determine if any configuration is present that disables Apple's default TLS enforcement.

By disabling Apple's default protections, this allows the application to transmit data in plain-text over HTTP. This allows anyone on the same network as the device to view this data as it is being transmitted. If the attacker is positioned to intercept traffic going to and from the device, they can also alter the data, potentially corrupting or compromising the application as a result. These configuration options should be removed and any communication from the application should be performed over HTTPS.

Information about Cocoa Keys

Acceptance Tests:

  • The getting started page that is available without a device code loads
  • App functions well under normal usage in the regression tests stage
  • A PDF uploaded with an insecure url in it can successfully open the URL

requirements.name: Remove HTTP unsecured exception from manifest

description.body:
Make sure to check for and replace any http requests with https.

We probably only used http to interact with the dev environment.  All of our services are now over HTTPS, so we should have no need for this.

data.name: As [ Chris Eiker, an iOS User ] I want to [ have always on continue to report position, even If the device is stationary ], so that I can [ look at the map at any given moment and find all my apparatus ].

description.body:
[ Grant ] The new "Background GPS" feature within the iOS app stops reporting the position of a device after it is idle/stationary for an unspecified period of time. Users want this feature to report the position of their devices, even when the device is stationary/idle.

[ Britt ] When the iOS app is using the background location reporting feature, if the device is stationary for about 5 minutes or longer, the device drops from the map. When the device starts moving again it takes about a minute for the device to reappear on the map. The device should stay on the map despite being stationary for a long period of time.

Acceptance Tests:

  • With precise accuracy on, staying in the same place for 10 minutes should still report my position to other clients.
  • With no background reporting on, my icon should disappear after about 6 minutes.

data.name: As [ Bryan, an iOS user ] I want to [ always be seen on the map using the reduced accuracy setting ], so that I can [ report my general location without wrecking my battery ].

description.body:
[ Bryan ] Little confused here. Reduced accuracy passed multiple QA checkpoints, but does not seem to be working in the latest version of production.

Is it just that the code we wrote is not acting like we expect when a device isn't moving?

Bryan Walcott - initial version of this feature appears to not function at all. Will be rewriting/reimplementing it for this ticket.

Acceptance Tests:

  • When reduced accuracy is on, as I move my position is being updated according to iOS's background standards when the app is backgrounded and also after it has been terminated.
  • When reduced accuracy is on (and foreground GPS is on), my position is updated normally when I am in the Active911 app.
  • When reduced accuracy is off, my position is updated normally when I am in the Active911 app.
  • When reduced accuracy is off, my position is not reported if the app is backgrounded.

data.name: As [ Zachary Stewart, an iOS User ] I want to [ have my client only show the "list view" in the reports option ], so that I can [ have the format displayed correctly each time I go into the report view ].

description.body:
My department uses the report feature that compiles all the call times into an email report. The guys are are having to choose the "list" option because the "group" option only displays the hours and the minutes of the time stamp. We need to have the seconds for our fire reporting software. If there was a way to choose which way the report automatically displays, it would remove an extra step that the guys wont have to do before emailing the report.

Acceptance Tests:

  • When I open the report page, there should be no option to switch between list and group.
  • The responses should be binned by day
  • Each response should use medium length timestamp format (hh:mm:ss am/pm)
  • All responses for the alert should be recorded
  • I should still be able to send that report as an email
  • The button/cell text for navigating to the view & the title for the view itself should both be "Log"

data.name: As [ Tyler Gibbs, an iOS User ] I want to [ have a chat view ], so that I can [ see and post messages to my friends ].

description.body:
Acceptance Tests, while the app is open:

  • I can navigate to this chat list from the navigation bar of my app
  • For each message, I need to see the senders device name, in the case of multiple agencies pick the lowest agency id.
  • For each message, I need to see the senders message
  • I need to have a space to type a message
  • When I hit return, my message starts a new line
  • I need to have the ability to send a message, in the case of multiple agencies pick post to the lowest agency id.
  • I can have a "short term history" that keeps a record of all conversations while my app is open
  • When I start the app from a cold reboot, the chat history should be blank
  • I cannot send an empty message

data.name: As [ Stephanie Rowen, an iOS User ] I want to [ have a chat list containing each of my agencies ], so that I can [ select one of my agencies to begin chatting ].

description.body:
[ Bryan ] Given a chat view where all messages are being displayed for all departments, Users will expect agency granularity.


Acceptance Tests:

  • I can navigate to this chat list from the navigation bar of my app
  • A list of my agencies is populated
  • I can tap on any of those agencies to go to an Agency Chat view (different story)
  • From this chat list, I can go back to my previous screen
  • When in the Agency Chat View, I see only messages from that agency chat
  • I need to know which agency I am chatting with when in the chat view
  • For each message, I need to see the senders device name
  • For each message, I need to see the senders message
  • I need to have a space to type a message
  • I need to have the ability to send a message
  • I need to be able to go back to the chat list view

requirements.name: multiline messages

description.body: ...haven't seen this in the requirements yet for the chatview tickets so I'm adding it to this ticket.  It's in regard to an oddity specific to iOS which we probably want to address - tableviewcells by default are fixed height, but in the context of chat we probably want it to be dynamic so that a cell can contain more than one line of text if necessary. So I'm adding this subtask to look into / address this issue.

This is functional, but hides chat messages that were previously at the top of the screen. This subtask is a placeholder to remind me to look into ways of dynamically scaling the view components themselves (as a more 'optimal' solution for this).

data.name: As [ a User with an A911 App that can no longer update Active911 from the store ] I want to [ continue to use my app without the new colors and icons ], so that [ my app doesn't crash when my agency adds markers with new colors/icons ].

description.body:
[ Bryan ] We have about 600 users that can no longer perform iOS app updates. Adding unexpected colors and icons to these clients will cause the app to become unstable and crash when they are encountered. We need a way to return a safe default if it's something they are not expecting.

I've attached the conversation where we determined how many users would be impacted, and the latest iTunesConnect Analytics data.

—

[ Ryan ] We have the same issue w/ Android - it also needs to return safe defaults when using old versions of the app.

Acceptance Tests:

  • Android:
    • For all current Android releases 
      1. Should show all NFPA+original icons and all five original colors on the map
      2. Should be able to edit/create an icon on the map with an NFPA or original icon and w/ one of the original five colors.
      3. Any icon manually edited in the DB for a color outside of the original five should show up as blue in the first two tests (and shouldn't crash).
      4. Any icon manually edited in the DB for an icon outside of the original set should show up as a flag in the first two tests (and shouldn't crash).
        1. The same test as #4 but original set + NFPA for Android builds > 74 but less than next release
    • For next Android release
      1. Should show all NFPA+original+new icons and original+new colors on the map
      2. Should be able to edit+create a single icon on the map with an NFPA+original+new icon and original+new colors
  • iOS:
    • for an iOS app build <= 1.5.11
      • Should show all the original 21 icons and all five original colors on the map.
      • Should be able to edit/create a icon on the map with a or original icon and w/ one of the original five colors
      • Any icon manually edited in the DB for a color outside of the original five should show up as blue in the first two tests (and shouldn't crash).
      •  Any icon manually edited in the DB for an icon outside of original set should show up as a flag in the first two tests (and shouldn't crash).
    • for an iOS app build > 1.5.11 && <= 1.5.15
      • Same as Android = 'current releases'  tests cases above (1-4), but run on iOS.
    • for the next iOS app build ( > 1.5.15 )
      • Same as Android = 'next release' test cases above (1-2), but run on iOS.

data.name: As [ an Active911 User that maintains a department webpage ] I want to [ insert a web widget from active911 data that contains a map ], so that I can [ communicate the value of the fire department to the community we serve ].

description.body:
[ Jon ]

The web widget no longer has a Static Map.

This is because Google removed anonymous access for their Static Maps API last year.

To fix, we either need to add our API key to the widget, or allow the customer to supply their own.

[ Bryan ] We need to adjust the widget to accept a google API key and provide instructions on setting a free one up.

[ Acceptance Tests ]

  • When programming the widget, If I put in an API key a map shows up
  • When programming the widget, If I do not put an API key in, no map shows up

custom_fields.name: Steps To Reproduce
custom_fields.body:
Add the web widget to a webpage following the instructions from the Wiki:

http://wiki.active911.com/wiki/index.php/Publishing_your_alarms:_RSS_and_web_widgets

The web widget will show the calls, but no static map

feature.name: As [ a Product Manager ] I want to [ ensure a level of redundancy in our Monitoring/Alerting Stacks ], so that I can [ be confident we can handle outages to one area or another ].

requirements.name: Make old nagios monitor new nagios

description.body:
Add new nagios as a monitored host in the old nagios server.

The old nagios server should directly interact with the new nagios container.

That means having the NRPE plugin run inside the container, and having the container expose the endpoint that the old nagios system connects to.

This allows us to not have to augment the docker host, and cleanly remove the Nagios monitoring when we no longer need it (When Grafana stack is solidified)

data.name: As [ Bryan, the Product Manager ] I want to [ have a "nightly" build of agency chat on all three platforms (Tablet, Phone, PC) ], so that I can [ finally schedule Windows work with confidence and not juggle Windows features around technical debt ].

description.body:
[ Bryan ] With how this project started, we have come a long way but we have still not met the "promise" of a unified codebase. The project routinely runs into overages in time, complexity, and effort and is a black hole of development effort.

It is also a stain on our reputation because we made changes to one project and could not build either of the other two. We look inept when we cannot rapidly adjust to bugs and features on a platform we say we support. As it sits, we have not had a phone release in over a year despite all the work we have put into it. If we needed to build the tablet I am not certain we could, never mind fixing a bug quickly.

To tackle this in an agile fashion, we need to treat the tablet version like the Android tablet version. Basically a direct port of the phone's views and functionality so we can do things in the acceptance tests:

[ Acceptance Tests ]

  • Deploy all the clients
  • Have them work as anticipated
  • Make small adjustments to each project without destroying the integrity of the project as a whole
  • Not shove one of the clients into a dark corner and hope it goes away
  • Stop incurring debt we will have to deal with later
  • Stop sending Robert down more Windows black holes.
  • Stop juggling independent releases from different points in code

data.name: As [ a Windows User ] I want to [ stay connected to XMPP ], so that I can [ get messages without restarting my app ].

description.body:
When a new call comes in, the app must be restarted before the information is visible in the app

[ Ryan ]

I was able to reliably reproduce this bug as well. The problem is just that the app no longer reconnects to XMPP if it loses it's connection.

More detailed steps to reproduce:

1. Open the pc app (and register if this is the first time opening the app).

2. Turn on debug features and open logging window.

3. Verify that there is periodic XMPP communication (at minimum there will be a ping w/ both a Send & Receive.)

4. Disconnect device from the internet.

5. Wait and watch the log until you see a couple of pings and then "SAFELY HANDLED IOException on TcpSocket" and a blank "XMPP Recv:" (shouldn't take more than a minute).

6. Reconnect to the internet.

7. Now the app will no longer receive alerts until it is restarted.

 

Acceptance Tests

  • I can leave the app open and receive alerts before and after manually disconnecting from the internet for the following intervals:

20 seconds, 1 minute, & 5 minutes

  • I can leave the app open, disconnect the device from the internet, get sent an alert, and will receive the alert(s) that was sent while disconnected when the app detects that we are reconnected:

Trials of single+multiple alerts during the same disconnected periods as above.

data.name: As [ Bryan, a Windows User ] I want to [ have an agency chat view ], so that I can [ see and post messages to my agency ].

description.body:
Acceptance Tests:

  • I need to know which agency I am chatting with
  • For each message, I need to see the senders device name
  • For each message, I need to see the senders message
  • I need to have a space to type a message
  • I need to have the ability to send a message
  • I need to be able to go back to the chat list view
  • I should have a chat history during each session. When I start up the app, the history starts getting populated.
  • After a cold reboot, the chat history should be blank.
  • Colons ( : ) should not cause unexpected behavior in the chats.
  • I cannot send an empty message
  • I should have a way to enter newlines

data.name: As [ a Website user who can send alerts ] I want to [ have a confirmation box when I am sending an alert to everyone ], so that I must [ confirm I want to page everyone and not inadvertently page the entire department ].

description.body:
[ Bryan ] We have been fielding concerns about large departments accidentally sending an alert to everyone. On large agencies, an alert triggers a drilled response that is difficult to recall, wasting time, effort, manpower and active911 goodwill. A quick stopgap measure of making them select everyone should ensure the right people are dispatched.

Acceptance Tests:

  • When I hit send with everyone as the pagegroup, I get a confirmation box
  • When I hit send with anything else, the message is sent right away.
  • The confirmation box says "Are you sure you want to send this to everyone?" and has a yes, no option.
  • Selecting No in the popup returns you to the send alert page
  • Selecting Yes in the popup sends the message

[ Britt ] Everyone in the confirmation box should be bolded

data.name: XMPP BLOCKS 496: Add assignment_override boolean to XMPP message

description.body:
RELEASE NOTE: Finalize Documentation with change to the XMPP string 

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1RTOlE6RgNc0OdrfEClwffvAJDH2tG97t8T196cSdfKM/edit

Right now the update only contains the assignment_id.  It should also contain whether it is an assignment override.

data.name: As [ Bryan, a User editing a location on Android ] I want to [ have my map update in realtime when I make changes to locations ], so that I can [ avoid going to a mistaken location if I forget to refresh my map ].

description.body:
As a [ User ]

I want to change [ locations not updating when I drag and drop on the map ] in [ the Android Client ],

so that I can better [ know where my locations are ].

  • Right now android only updates it's locations when you open the app/map. There's an xmpp message that goes out whenever a location is updated, android needs to listen for this message and update it's internal location store accordingly.

Acceptance Tests:

  • When in an Android Client, when I drag and drop and confirm the move, my map updates without changing the screen.

  • If I cancel the move, the position of the marker does not change from where it should be.

data.name: As [ an Android User ] I want to [ be able to send an Email reporting on the responses of a specific alert ], so that I can [ distribute that information more easily for writing reports ].

description.body:
Report export per alarm like the IOS app has.

Acceptance Tests:

  • Button that directs to an email
  • Subject should be "Active911: <insert alert title>"
  • Body should start with a line "Report generated on <device name> using Active911"
  • There should be an "Alert" Header that prints out name value associations of alert data, one line per entry
  • Alert section should contain the fields from the alert, specifically the alert id, title, address, city, and date.
  • The alert section should not have the notes, that is it's own section.
  • Body should contain a "Log" Header that reports the contents of the report log page.
  • Log section should appear as a comma separated list, one entry per line, containing the date in mo/day/yr, the timestamp of the response to hundredth of a second, the response and who responded.
  • The body should contain a "Details" Header
  • The details section should report the notes field.
  • User must enter an email address to be able to send it.

data.name: As [ an Android User ] I want to [ be able to un-assign a device from an assignment ], so that I can [ properly tell a person they have no current assignment ].

description.body:
Acceptance Tests:

  • From the settings, changing my assignment to something other than automatic updates the personnel view without a reload/refresh.
  • From the settings, changing my assignment to automatic will move me to my scheduled assignment in the personnel view without a reload/refresh.
  • From the settings, changing my assignment to automatic with no scheduled assignment will set me unassigned in the personnel view without a reload/refresh.
  • From the personnel page, Automatic will resume a devices scheduled assignment in the view if an assignment is scheduled.
  • From the personnel page, Automatic will move a device to unassigned if there is not a scheduled assignment it is in.
  • Changing my own assignment to something other than automatic from the personnel page should update the settings page with the correct assignment.
  • Changing my own device to automatic from the personnel page should update the settings page automatically, placing me in automatic.
  • A user can be moved from unassigned to a new assignment without an error.
  • A user can be moved from unassigned to an existing assignment without an error.
  • A user can be moved from an existing assignment can be moved to Automatic without an error.

goals.name: Iterate to make experimental Gadgets Reliable

custom_fields.name: Steps To Reproduce
custom_fields.body:
1. Opened a call in the app and selected a response. Response appeared to update on the device , but report showed no data available. A secondary device was not seeing the updated status either. The database confirmed that no response was being received by the device. Navigated to another app to confirm internet access was good and was successfully able to use other apps online. Restarted the app and the issue changed to the app just hanging on the response pending animation. This was replicated on both cell data and WiFi.

 

Eventually the app started working again, and am not able to reproduce at this moment.

data.name: As [ Mark Potts, a GIS guy for a fire department ] I want to [ have Wiz reliably interpolate the correct location of addresses not specifically defined ], so that I can [ have a good coordinate on an address even if it is not a direct match ].

description.body:
[ From Mark ]

geocoder.js line 164 OBSERVATION:
Don't know for what "match.type" is used, but its value of 'exact' or
'approximate' looks to be of dubious value since the test is based on
a match of every characteristic of the full normalized input street
address and the GIS-supplied street address. Couldn't these differ by
a single, unimportant character or case thereof and still be an 'exact'
match?

geocoder.js FOR IMPROVED INTERPOLATOR, REPLACE LINES 194-195 WITH:
{{ var Latn = parseFloat(result.rows[n]. lat.toString());}}{{
}}{{ var Latnp1 = parseFloat(result.rows[n+1].lat.toString()); }}{{
}}{{ var Lonn = parseFloat(result.rows[n]. lon.toString());}}{{
}}{{ var Lonnp1 = parseFloat(result.rows[n+1].lon.toString());}}{{
}}{{ var Tdist = parseFloat(result.rows[n+1].number.toString()) -}}{{
}}{{ parseFloat(result.rows[n]. number.toString());}}{{
}}{{ var Adist = parseFloat(an.number) -}}{{
}}{{ parseFloat(result.rows[n]. number.toString());}}{{
}}{{ var Rat = 0.5;}}{{
}}{{ if (Tdist > 0)

{ Rat = Adist / Tdist; }

}}{{
}}{{ match.lat = Latn * Rat + Latnp1 * (1.0 - Rat);}}{{
}}{{ match.lon = Lonn * Rat + Lonnp1 * (1.0 - Rat); }}
NB: (1) I really believe that 'result.rows[ ].lat' and equivalent for
.lon are numbers, but I followed the lead of the code that I found and
have added the (probably superfluous) toString() everywhere.
(2) That test for Tdist > 0 is simply an insurance policy against
someone changing the preceding logic that currently guarantees this
will always be true.

[ Bryan ] I'd like someone to evaluate his code to see if it provides value. If it does, update wiz. Otherwise give me the brief talking points on why it does not work or do what he thinks it does.

data.name: As [ Captain Jeremy Wade, an Administrator of Frederick County ], I want to [ turn off chat for all my department ], so that I can [ avoid potential misuse that would result in losing Active911 ].

description.body:
Acceptance Tests:

  • A user with edit agency can toggle agency chat on and off.
  • When chat is off, no client can see that agency's chatroom.
  • When chat is on, any client can see that agency's chatroom.
  • When a new/existing device is added to the agency, it's chat capability matches the on/off setting of the agency.

RELEASE NOTES:

The code changes will handle setting defaults for all new agencies + memberships... but we will need to do a one time update on pre-existing data when this feature is deployed. The following queries should do the trick (be sure to do a test run first):

-- adds chat to capabilities for EVERY row in membership (if it doesn't already exist)
-- will include a comma if it is adding it to an existing list
UPDATE membership SET capabilities = IF(capabilities='', 'chat', CONCAT(capabilities, ',chat')) where capabilities not like '%chat%';

-- replaces ALL agency options with slightly modified version...
-- last '}' becomes: ',"chat":"yes"}'
UPDATE agencies SET options = CONCAT( SUBSTRING(options, 1, CHAR_LENGTH(options) - 1), ',"chat":"yes"}');

data.name: Alarms By Type user parsing

description.body:
Currently, at least with our view, we receive 'alarm by type' (Agency tab) data broken down into two categories; EMS or Other. If, in a format similar to the Group Paging, each agency could define the alarm types as sent by their dispatch agency, the data and pie chart would be of greater value. The graph could not only represent each individual call type as defined by the agency, but also a broader definition Example: EMS = MED, MEDX, BLS, BLSN. Fire = FR, FC, FB. etc. The user could select a pie chart and data listing based upon either the Grouping or drilled down to the actual call type. In addition, date ranges could be specified or at least a preset range: This month, Last Month, Year to Date, Last 2 months, Last year, etc.

Acceptance Tests:

1. Log into the web interface and go to the Alerts tab.

  • Verify existence of a “type” column

2. Click on an alarm and scroll to the bottom.

  • See dropdown box
  • Dropdown box contains many (100+) types
  • Selecting a type and clicking “save” causes the alerts tab to update showing new type

3. Click on the same alert again

  • You should see the previously selected type still visible

4. Select type “Fire / Structure / Chimney”

  • Technical description appears below dropdown
  • Technical description contains “see also” suggestions
  • Click one of the “see also” suggestions and verify that it jumps to that type
  • Close the dialog box and confirm that the alerts tab has updated the NFIRS code

data.name: Add search capability to alert type

description.body:
Users would like the ability to do a full text search of all alert types instead of always having to pick one. They would also like the ability to type in an NFIRS code and see that type.

Acceptance tests:

1) Open an alert in the Alerts tab. Scroll down to Type.

  • Verify existence of Filter box
  • Start typing something in Filter, see things filter
  • Verify filter action feels intuitive

2) Click on an alert type

  • Verify Save button appears
  • Verify description appears
  • Push Save button and verify it saves (in background, on Alert tab)
  • Save button disappears after saving

3) Legacy test

  • Open in a legacy browser (e.g., IE running in v9 mode)
  • Try the above tests

data.name: Lock Screen - Response Options not updating consistently in iOS

description.body:
Current behavior:

If you change the agency response options via the web-interface:

  1. The response options for an alert detail view in the iOS app will update after the app is backgrounded and reopened (get all volatile data)
  2. The response options in the APN when app isn’t open (banner or lockscreen) will update after the app is force closed and reopened (set during app initial start up).

Desired behavior:

Ideally we would like these to update without the app changing state.

Alternatively as a half measure we could make sure that both of these places where the response options are visible update at the same time (during the same app state change).

Acceptance tests:

– Send an alert to 2 agencies that the iOS device is part of, one that will be changed and one that will not.

– With the iOS app open, change the response vocabulary for an agency the device is part of.

– Background the app, wait for 1 min, and then reopen the app.

– The response buttons for an alert to the changed agency should have the new response vocabulary.

– Background the app again. Send a new alert to the device using that agency.

– The response buttons for the APN notifcation of the new alert should contain the new response vocabulary

– Send an alert to the other agency the device is part of. It’s response vocabulary should be the same as it was before

data.name: As [ Joseph O'Neill, a firefighter ], I want to [ be able to log into active911 without an error ], so that I can [ do things like pay for Active911 ].

description.body:
It looks like we need to adjust our phone number / email validation on the web interface's login screen.

When I try to enter the email address into the login field and leave the password blank, I get the

Fatal error: Uncaught Error type: 1. The string supplied did not seem to be a
phone number. thrown in
/var/www/interface/vendor/giggsey/libphonenumber-for-php/src/libphonenumber/PhoneNumberUtil.php
on line 1392

[Acceptance tests:]

A support tech can log in using their email

A support tech can log in with their phone number

A user with a ' can log in using their email

A user with a ` can log in using their phone number

Invalid passwords still return an error

description.body:
Acceptance Tests:

  • As an admin of the department, I can use that "group code" to get the group pricing when paying or generating an invoice.
  • If the "group code" is expired when trying to purchase a subscription, do not process the payment and instead display a warning that it has expired

  • When a group code is used, the amount I am billed should be the number of devices I selected X the group rate.
  • When a group code is used, the invoice I receive should match what I paid.
  • When adding new subscriptions after an initial purpose, the price should prorate from the group rate.

Nightly tests:

  • Agency 3 should have a purchase price of 11.99 anywhere you can think of.
  • Some other agency should have normal pricing

data.name: improve alert server monthly log rotation

description.body:
Motivation:

The impetus being that because of way this is currently handled, our reliability is put at risk on two fronts:

1. False alarms can distract/desensitize devops from actual issues.

2. The added load caused by the current method is a risk factor by itself (especially as a compounding effect w/ any other simultaneous problems). 

 

Story:

As a DevOps engineer I want the monthly alert server log rotation to run in a low-impact/low-priority manner to avoid overloading our server resources. 

 

Implementation/technical details:

Currently when the first alert of each month is created for an agency, all the alerts from the previous month are cleared out (some many process scenarios allowed by this design can cause high load spikes). I think this feature should be moved out of the alert server code and instead should be something like an cronjob triggered script that uses ionice to do the same thing over the same time period but in a way which will avoid load spikes.

data.name: Alert Server - Unable to properly interpret a nested message

description.body:
A conversation I had with Tier 3 at the time of the problem.

Jon recommends adding a JSON option to the agency to change where we attempt to grab a content at a certain spot, then default to the first if we find nothing.

So I would lean towards a JSON option and adding a parameter to the MessageExtract library

[10:47]
which defaults to the current behavior so it wouldn't change anything for anyone else

 

 

** Full Conversation **

jonathan [10:40]
if we wanted to make a fix on our side, we would need to add a parameter to the specify which of the parts with the same name to take, as long as the ordering remained consistent

bryan [10:41] 

no way to take it all, is there?

jonathan [10:41]
we could concatenate all text, but that would change how it works for other agencies possibly

bryan [10:42]
is there a query to find out?

[10:42]
probably not, we aren’t storing the raw_messages in the database

jonathan [10:43]
we would need to iterate through the alert log files on the alert servers

bryan [10:43]
we do have a new spiffy centralized repo of logs though, right?

[10:44]
we have…json options?

jonathan [10:44]
its just a big file system. it doesnt speed it up much

[10:44]
in this case

[10:44]
also its only in dev atm

bryan [10:44]
thats fine

[10:45]
just eliminating options

jonathan [10:45]
basically we need to either devise a solution that doesn't affect the output for all of our current customers, or we need to add a flag/option of some sort to the agency and then have that trigger a change in the way we parse the email

[10:46]
if we make a change that affects output, we will need to rerun all the poly tests to generate new hashes

bryan [10:46]
that would suck ass

[10:46]
and we wouldn’t be sure something didn’t get missed

jonathan [10:47]
So I would lean towards a JSON option and adding a parameter to the MessageExtract library

[10:47]
which defaults to the current behavior so it wouldn't change anything for anyone else

feature.name: As [ an iOS User ] I want to [ have the ability to only get calls a certain radius from my position ], so that I can [ respond effectively to incidents near me ].

description.body: Would like to see a feature that would send alerts to my device only if the call for service was a certain radius from my location. In other words I'm out and about and I don't want an alert on every single call within out 654 square mile county, but a CPR comes out a few blocks from my location, I want to be alerted. I could see this as a user defined switch that would allow the user to turn on this feature on/off (due to potential battery drain). It could also be integrated as one of the on/off duty options. Maybe I'm on shift and I want to set it to 7a-7p today. The next day I'm off and want to set it to geofence only. Would also like the radius to be user defined.

Acceptance Tests:

  • In OTRS, users with the appropriate permissions should be able to see a survey tab and modify it.

data.name: As [ Bryan, the PM ] I want to [ replace our existing homepage with an updated one ], so that I can [ begin the transition to our new brand images ].

description.body:
[ Bryan ] We need a responsive, fast new website. We spent a lot of money redesigning our brand and it's time to show it off. Most of the heavy lifting has been done on the design, style and overall feel of the new site. Now I just have a few requirements you need to keep in mind as we go to build it.

Some Inspiration on how the parallax should work:

http://us.puma.com/en_US/home?locale=en_US&mktID=PL:Brand%20Marketing:Puma.com-CatchAllPage:United%20States-en&plinkID=Brand for the zoom effect on the how we work section

http://www.boy-coy.com/#home for the layering, general effects of the bolded words.

Acceptance Tests:

  • It must pipe into google analytics
  • It needs to be designed to not be a single point of failure
  • It should be hosted somewhere relatively hidden where we can route some people to it, but not everyone.
  • It should be on a "nightly" deployment schedule.
  • It needs to be "responsive" with mobile first in mind.
  • Needs to support parallax.

data.name: iOS11 precise BG position reporting timeout

description.body: The method we were using for ensuring that we sent at least one position every 5 minutes no longer worked in iOS11. You can ask the location manager for a position update as much as you want... but if your location hasn't changed it will no longer reply (previously it would reply with just the same location). I couldn't find this change in behavior documented anywhere... but it's not necessarily a blocker: we can still just manually report the same stale location to our services without using the iOS location manager for this use case anymore.

data.name: possible issues with quotes in slack->abot command arguments.

description.body: For multi word arguments they need to be quoted in order to be properly handled. I ran into an issue with this with one of the commands (see steps to reproduce)

or

> shift create ‘test_name1’ 0,1,0,1,1,1,1,1,1 “testing_description… a”

data.name: iOS Bug - alert list view becomes unresponsive

description.body:
Stumbled across a new bug today while working on iOS. Every cell for an alert in this view starts a 60 second reload timer upon creation/receiving the alert. If this reload occurs while the agency is collapsed an error is thrown and caught in such a way that the app does not crash... but the view itself still ends up in a broken/unresponsive state. This fix should be pretty straightforward... just don't run the reload if section is collapsed.

#Nightly:

Build to use:

https://dev1-or.active911.com/ios/Active911_2017-10-17_16-38-21_1.5.17_4808/active911-ios-1.5.17-4808-DEV.ipa

Compare against any prod / app store build. Prod builds should have a bug/issue if you perform the following steps, but this nightly build should not.

  1. Open the app to the Alerts view.
  2. Send yourself an alert.
  3. Collapse the agency that contains the new alert.
  4. Wait 60 seconds.
  5. Try to uncollapse the agency again.
  6. All the agency headers will turn gray when tapped... but will no longer collapse/open until the app is fully closed and reopened.

data.name: iOS11 APNs delayed alert 'bug'

description.body:
Was able to consistently reproduce another difference in the Apple Push Notification behavior for alerts in iOS 8,9,10, vs 7 & 11.

 

If you send alerts to both devices while the app is backgrounded (might also apply when the app is closed - this needs testing),

don't tap on / respond to the notification banner.

wait 10 seconds.

open the app. 

 

in iOS 11 (and before 8)... the alert wasn't fetched and added to the view, so it won't show up until get_all_volatile data finishes.

 

This adds about 3+ seconds to a users response time (if they are using this workflow)... and more if they have to download a lot of alerts.

data.name: As [ Brady Bumbaugh, an Active911 evangelist ], I want to [ have pagegroup forwarding respect my departments duplicate detection ], so that I can [ prevent mutual aid request spam, which stresses my firefighters and causes alarm fatigue ].

description.body:
Acceptance Tests:

Given to agencies, Original and Mutual

  • When Original gets a new SNPP/STMP message, it properly parses and sends
  • When Original gets a duplicate SNPP/SMTP message, it properly interprets the duplicate settings
  • When Mutual gets a forward from Original, it will use the originals parser to interpret the message
  • When Mutual gets an update from Original, it checks it's own duplicate settings
  • If the original parser returns an address, ignore the agency radius and map it anyway

Additional Information:

I talked directly with Brady Bumbaugh, who gave me a brief rundown of the situation.

Thier CAD (TriTech) had an update performed that broke the ability of the cad to send 1 alert with all the pagegroups, so they followed the "Tritech Certified" path of each unit being it's own email. Our natural rate limiter of every 8 seconds started causing massive delays (There could be upwards of 10-15 updates to a structure fire, leading to the last unit being dispatched almost 2 minutes late). Subsequent contact with Tritech Reps has been unsuccessful at reverting the update, basically disabling their ability to respond cohesively.

When they contacted support, Tyler figured out a way to ease the problem in a way that the County thinks is an optimization from even the previous way of doing things. They established a County account and are in the process of simplifying how their dispatch communicates with Active911 by basically establishing "Run Boxes" or "Run Cards."

Specific Example:

Agency 23609 has a pagegroup named: CO.07FIRE BR7 E7_1 E7_2 F07 RG7 SQ7 UT7 Weather FCE7_1 FCE7_2 FCSQ7 FCBR7 FCRIT7 FCRANGER7 FCU7 FA7 FAE71 FAE72 FARS7 FABR7 FLE7_1 FLE7_2 FLSQ7 FLB7 FLRIT7 FLU7 FLRANGER7

It Forwards to

Fayetteville VFD CO 7 FIRE RUNS  
South Central PA Apparatus Tablets FSFRANKLIN07 FIRE CALLS  

They have 60 of these prepared, but are only testing on one department.

data.name: As [ Bryan, a Windows user ] I want to [ have responses remembered for each alert ], so that I can [ have correct and up to date information like other clients ].

description.body:
[ User ] When you get a call and you update your status (STA, SCENE, UNAVA, etc.) it will reflect your status. If another call comes in around the same time or shortly after and you update the status on that call, it then removes the status from your previous call. Allow it to maintain the status for each call so that we can see who is reponding to the first call and who is responding or on a delay to the second call. We have incidents where you are almost finish with one call and another call comes in. You can see who is on each call and who will be responding to the next call. Example: I'm on call 1 and call 2 comes in. I am finishing on call 1 and will be responding to call 2, so I mark my status as DELAY. The call 2 people can see who is on call 1 and also see who from call 1 is coming to call 2 (or vice-versa).

[ Bryan ] Windows is the last client to get this. We want persistent responses tied to each alert. In the previous 2 clients, we have failed to update the report list view or anticipate the subsequent bugs they introduced, hence the rather large amount of acceptance tests.

Acceptance Tests:

  • From an alert, tapping a response marks me as responding in my client.
  • From an alert, tapping a response updates the response list on iOS
  • From an alert, tapping a response updates the response list on Android
  • From the alert, tapping a response updates the response list on other windows devices
  • The report page should correctly log any response action taken on that alert, whether it is your device or a second device.
  • When in an alert, a response from an iOS client properly updates my response list
  • When in an alert, a response from an Android client properly updates my response list
  • I can leave an alert with a response, view a different alert, mark a different response and then return to see my old response in the first alert.
  • When receiving an updated alert from an alert edit, the original responses are still recorded.
Sort the alarm responders list by responding, not responding, name, location, etc.

data.name: As [ Adam Ethier, a Windows User ] I want to [ be able to see all of the map markers in a given view, not a random, fluctuating subset ], so that I can [ trust Active911 to make well informed decisions on which hydrant to use. ].

description.body:
[ Ryan] pc app only displays partial set of map icon pins for a particular agency

The easiest way for me to describe this problem is in relation to how this feature of the map works on some of our other platforms (e.g. iOS). So basically as you pan/zoom the map around, on each refresh the app is calculating the visible frame, and will display icons inside the frame (also loading them from access server if necessary), and will hide icons outside of the frame (off screen).

In this particular instance (see video in OTRS ticket or try it yourself via 'steps to reproduce') the app is acting like it has calculated a visible frame which doesn't actually match the current map view window (it's too small & only icons in the middle of the map are being displayed).

data.name: As [ Bryan, the Product Manager ] I want to [ have a visual cue to tell me if I am actually connected to Active911 ], so that I can [ tell at a glance if my device is connected to Active911 ].

description.body:
Some sort of symbol, icon, or display that makes it obvious when the PC app is not connected to the internet and xmpp. May be nice if it makes it clear when the app is connected. As an example, a green light when things are good and a red light when things are bad.

 

Acceptance Tests

  1. There is a visual cue on the main window of the app with two states that tells me if I'm currently connected to A911, which updates when xmpp connects/disconnects and when access is available/unavailable.

data.name: As [ a Windows PC User ] I want to [ specify which com port I expect my GPS to be on ], so that I can [ use the other COM ports for my other gadgets ].

description.body:
[ Jon ] Specify what COM port to use for GPS in Windows PC

As a user, I want to specify what COM port to use instead of scanning so that it does not interfere with other applications that need to listen on other COM ports

Requested by user

http://ticket.active911.com/otrs/index.pl?Action=AgentTicketZoom;TicketID=127298#423450

Set a com port

set a "scan" option

 

[ Acceptance Tests ]

  • I should be able to go to the Advanced settings tab and select a checkbox to enable specifying a COM port for GPS.
  • I should be able to enter a specific COM port only when the checkbox is checked.
  • I should not be able to enter a non-numerical COM port.
  • The app should remember whether this settings is enabled and which COM port is specified between restarts.
  • After enabling this feature, and restarting the app, the app should connect to a GPS over the COM port without scanning for COM ports.
  • If enabled, and there is not a GPS device connected, the app will not connect to the COM port, but will try again at the same interval that it normally checks for new COM ports.

data.name: As [ an Android User ] I want to [ have the ability to only get calls a certain radius from my position ], so that I can [ respond effectively to incidents near me ].

description.body:
Acceptance Tests:

  • A User can change their Agency Duty Status to "Off Duty, but Available"
  • When in"Off Duty, but Available", the only alerts I receive are within a hidden, default radius (5 miles of my location)
  • When in"Off Duty, but Available", my background GPS must not be "off"
  • If I set "Off Duty, but Available", and my background GPS is "off", change it to "Reduced Accuracy".
  • If I change the background GPS to off while an agency is set to off duty but available, a popup is shown telling me that the agencies will be changed to off duty.
  • If I enable background GPS, a popup will be shown explaining that it uses more battery.
  • If I set "Off Duty, but Available", and background GPS is off, then a popup appears explaining that background gps will be enabled.
  • If I set off duty, but available and background gps was already enabled, there will be no popup.
  • On all three of these popups, there is a checkbox for do not display again. If checked, that particular popup should never show again.

feature.name: As [ an Android User ] I want to [ have the ability to only get calls a certain radius from my position ], so that I can [ respond effectively to incidents near me ].

description.body: Would like to see a feature that would send alerts to my device only if the call for service was a certain radius from my location. In other words I'm out and about and I don't want an alert on every single call within out 654 square mile county, but a CPR comes out a few blocks from my location, I want to be alerted. I could see this as a user defined switch that would allow the user to turn on this feature on/off (due to potential battery drain). It could also be integrated as one of the on/off duty options. Maybe I'm on shift and I want to set it to 7a-7p today. The next day I'm off and want to set it to geofence only. Would also like the radius to be user defined.

requirements.name: Fix Design Issues with the chat feature

description.body:
Bryan Walcott  added a comment - 31/Aug/17 9:32 AM
Looks mostly good. QA returned a couple of suggestions

  • User should not be able to send an empty message.  User shouldn't be able to send a message without typing something in the chat box.
  • Newlines from other departments return %0 and %20
  • The chat list view could use a little visual love.  Per Britt "When I tap on the Chat icon it takes me to a screen with the agency name. There is nothing indicating that I'm suppose to tap on the agency name to actually enter chat. To keep it consistent I would do the blue bold on the agency name on the chat tab and put a line under. Basically make it look more like the agency tab with only one agency listed. That also means increasing the top and bottom margins."
  • The size of the agency name in the chatroom is too large.  Per Britt "After you tap on the agency, I would change the size of the agency name at the top. You could do it in blue bold again and maybe one or 2 pts larger than the message size."

data.name: In the SDK upgrade we are doing, please confirm this won't be a problem or fix it.

description.body:
Special considerations:

This change is to support Android O going forward, so we need to make sure the change doesn't break Android Nougat in addition to working in Android O.

Also, there are 2 scanner radio apps, free and Pro. The code has to figure out which one is installed and send the wakeup call to it specifically now, so we need to make sure it works with either version of Scanner Radio.

Acceptance Tests:

Without Scanner Radio installed, the app will not let me choose an option for the "Scanner Radio on Alert" setting

After Scanner Radio is installed, I can Select one of my favorite stations to open upon alert.

When I have a station selected, upon alert, that scanner radio station will turn on in the background.

When I don't have a station selected, an alert will not open scanner radio.

This change also affects widgets:

When I tap on the Duty widget, my duty status changes to the next status in the cycle (On -> Off -> Auto -> On)

When I receive an alert, the launcher widget number increases.

When I read an alert, the launcher widget number decreases

data.name: As [ Adam Lee, an Active911 iOS User ] I want to [ be able to set my Active911 App to continuously page me until I respond ], so that I can [ never accidentally miss an alert I should have responded to ].

description.body:
[ Bryan ] We are aiming for making sure a user cannot miss the fact that they have been called out an alert. They need to perform some kind of response action to make it go away.

Acceptance Tests:

  • From a client, I can turn on continuous paging.
  • When enabled, Active911 will periodically (every 20 or so seconds) page out the device again.
  • If I am re-paged several times, I should only see one alert when I open the app.
  • If I open the app, the server knows to no longer page my device.
  • If I turn off continuous re-paging, I should only get one alert.
  • If I get an alert and respond to it, then an update to the alert comes in, it will continuously sound until I respond again.
  • If I get an alert for one agency, and it is sounding off, and then I get an alert for another agency that has a different ringtone, I should hear both ringtones.

QA:

  • Tyler would like a quick stress test, let it run for 30 minutes, check for adverse side effects.

data.name: As [ Jim Neal, an iOS User ] I want to [ see how many unread calls I have in Active911 from the app icon, before I open it ], so that I can [ know if I've unexpectedly missed an alert ].

description.body:
Acceptance Tests:

  • When I have Badge App Icon enabled in the phones notification settings, I can see the total of unread messages from my app icon in my list of apps.
  • When I have the Badge App Icon disabled in the phone notification settings, I cannot see the total of unread messages from my app icon in my list of apps
  • If I get a notification and do not open the app, the number should increment up without opening the app.
  • If I get a notification and open the notification, the number should remain the same when I leave the app.
  • If I read unread messages from the app, the number should decrease by the same number when I leave the app.

requirements.name: Add Alert Server query for badge count

description.body:
Need to calculate the # of unread messages server-side and pass it in in the APN payload.

Best method I could come up w/ was to join messages+alerts+response_actions... if a response action is missing we will consider it unread.

Note: This adds a non-trivial amount of processing to the alert-server + db so we will need to do load testing prior to release.

data.name: As [ Jon Snow, the anonymous user who reported this ], I want to [ make sure my iOS app does not crash when bad stuff comes from the access server ], so that I can [ not have my iOS app crash when I need it most ].

description.body:
non utf-8 chars in db causing access servers json_encode to not return valid json.

I haven't been able to pin it down to the specific set of characters which can cause the issue, but here's a current example of one that will fail:

The description field from location_id 9933675 (in table "locations");

goals.name: Violently React to Bugs that impair our Heroes

custom_fields.name: Steps To Reproduce
custom_fields.body:
The description field from location_id 9933675 (in table "locations");

 

On one of our iOS devices (dev ipad air 2), this location was being received from the access server with NULL for the description -> which keeps it from creating a valid alert object (with multiple null fields, including location_id) -> which then causes a crash when this null location_id is used elsewhere in the app.

When I tested the access server more directly (POST get_location and get_locations json datatype), I received invalid json errors.

data.name: As [ Bryan Walcott, the PM ], I want to [ have the contact workflow built ], so that I can [ enable users to easily contact us ].

description.body:
Contact should have the same style as create account, a box with a shaded view of the page they were on, with an X to close it.

 

Acceptance Tests:

* From the contact header button, I start the contact workflow.

* From the support page "Contact Us" button, I can start the contact workflow

* I should know I am contacting Active911

* I should be able to see we have a forum and know I can go there, closing my contact request in the process.

* I should see Active911's address, phone number, and support email.

* If I click on the email, it pops open my default email client with the right information.

 

* I should be able to enter my name

* I should be able to enter my email (bonus points for smart searching our users as they type and offering suggestions)

* I should be able to enter my phone number (bonus points for smart searching our phone numbers as they type and offering suggestions)

* There should be a space for me to type my concerns.

* I should be able to select whether I prefer email or phone.

* Whichever I select, As a support person I should be able to tell which one the user chose.

* When I submit, Support is actually contacted.


* At any point in the process, I can X out of the window and continue wherever I was going.
