data.name: As [ an Android User ], I want to [ change the default size of map markers to 2 ], so that I can [ have a reasonable map marker size without needing to change any settings ].

description.body:
We get quite a few complaints about map tags like for devices and the map markers being too small. The default right now is, I believe, 1. The default should be changed to 3 so people can actually read the default without having to go in and change the size.

Acceptance Tests:

  • A fresh install should have a map marker size of 2
  • Changing the map marker size should remember the value the next time the app is opened, no matter how the app was closed
  • Uninstalling and reinstalling should return the map marker size to 2.

data.name: I need Active911 to pull my alert data from a URL my dispatch center sends.

description.body:
Our cad system does not have the ability to send units assigned via the generated email and we have created a work around with Active911 in an attempt to accommodate this, but is not always 100% accurate. What is generated through our CAD is an expiring URL that contains our CAD Dispatch Card (D-CARD). This link has all of the incident information, units assigned, run notes, etc.

It is my understanding that a competitor of yours (Bryx911) has this ability and is something that would be extremely beneficial. Please let me know if this is something you can currently do, or could look into, as we have had good success with and would like to stay with Active911.

 

Examples can be found with agency 21244.


* Alarm: 107071924
* Received: 2017-11-21 19:33:36
* Subject: https://apps.clemis.org/ccp/d.aspx?ih=10522940~2-30d / FODORS / 2282 DORCHESTER RD N/APT 106
* From: CAD_Do-Not-Reply@oakgov.com
*
https://apps.clemis.org/ccp/d.aspx?ih=10522940~2-30d /FODORS/2282 DORCHESTER RD N/APT 106\r\n
\r\n

I've attached the general format of the D-Card they are describing.


Acceptance Tests:

* A Support Tech can set an agency to fetch from a url in the message, possibly 'application/website'

* If an agency is set as 'application/website', the alert server looks for a url in the message, fetches that data and saves it as the message that becomes parsed.

* Support can use poly to parse the contents of the url.

data.name: As [ an iOS user who can send alerts ] I want to [ have a confirmation box when I am sending an alert to everyone ], so that I must [ confirm I want to page everyone and not inadvertently page the entire department ].

description.body:
[ Bryan ] We have been fielding concerns about large departments accidentally sending an alert to everyone. On large agencies, an alert triggers a drilled response that is difficult to recall, wasting time, effort, manpower and active911 goodwill. A quick stopgap measure of making them select everyone should ensure the right people are dispatched.

Acceptance Tests:

  • When I hit send with everyone as the pagegroup, I get a confirmation box
  • When I hit send with anything else, the message is sent right away.
  • The confirmation box says "Are you sure you want to send this to everyone?" and has a yes, no option.
  • Selecting No in the popup returns you to the send alert page
  • Selecting Yes in the popup sends the message

[ Britt ] Everyone in the confirmation box should be bolded

tasks.name: UI/UX Decision/Sketch on how to handle this story

data.name: As [ an Active911 Windows User ] I want to [ be able to set my Active911 App to continuously page me until I respond ], so that I can [ never accidentally miss an alert I should have responded to ].

description.body:
[ Bryan ] We are aiming for making sure a user cannot miss the fact that they have been called out an alert.  They need to perform some kind of response action to make it go away.

Acceptance Tests:

  • From a client, I can turn on continuous paging.
  • When enabled, Active911 will periodically (every 20 or so seconds) page out the device again.
  • If I am re-paged several times, I should only see one alert when I open the app.
  • If I mark a response, the server knows to no longer page my device.
  • If I turn off continuous re-paging, I should only get one alert.

data.name: As [ Jason Acord, an Active911 Admin ], I want to [ be able to search multiple use devices with the name I've set for them ], so that I can [ find the multiple use device when I am looking for it ].

description.body:
When a device is a member of two agencies and has an agency specific name for each agency. The device is searchable in the device tab only by one of those agency specific names.

For instance, if device1 is a member of agency1 and agency2. And device1 is named 'Bob' on agency1 and named 'Fred' on agency2. Then you can go to the device tab for each agency and search for 'Bob' and each agency will show you device1 where as if you search for 'Fred' on either agency's device tab, you will get nothing. This is particularly problematic when an agency cannot find a device that is a part of it.

goals.name: Violently React to Bugs that impair our Heroes

custom_fields.name: Steps To Reproduce
custom_fields.body:
1. Create a device on an account.
  2. Add the device as a multiple use device to a second account.
  3. Rename the device on the second account.
  4. Go to the devices tab in the first account.
  5. Search for the device by the original name. This returns no results.
  6. Search for the device by the new name on the second account. This should return the device, even though the name appears as the original name.

data.name: Web Interface - Unable to delete a user with a single quote in their email

description.body:
If you try to delete a user with an email that has a quote in it (e.g. "o'conner@email.com"), it fails to delete and returns an SQL error. It seems like this would be because we aren't escaping that field, but it looks like we do escape it from the code. There may be a codepath that skips the escaping, but I couldn't find it with a cursory inspection. This is happening in the "save_users" function in interface.ajax.php.

 

It's easy to work around this issue. However it could potentially be used to exectute arbitrary SQL statements as a customer on our web interface. That's a huge security hole, so I'm giving this a higher priority than I would otherwise.

goals.name: Violently React to Bugs that impair our Heroes

data.name: As [ Andrew Doyle, an Active911 Admin ], I want to [ use the "missing" group to find missing pagegroup units ], so that I can [ create the proper pagegroups for any unit we are are responsible for ].

description.body:
If a unit is not in the CAD but others on the dispatch line are, no notification is made. This would ensure all units can be added into the system.

The current failover only works if no pagegroups are found. If a group is not found we want to send to "missing" if it exists with a line in the information on which unit it failed on.

Acceptance Tests:

  • If using the pagegroup options, sending to one or more groups that exist notify like normal.
  • If a unit does not exist and I do not have a "missing" group, do nothing.
  • If a unit does not exist and I have a "missing" group, append a message to the notes field stating which unit is missing and page out to the "missing" group.

  • Once I am logged in, I see logged in header information.

data.name: As [ a Windows User ] I want to [ have the option of having the map follow me as I drive ], so that I can [ be able to glance at my Active911 Map for positions while still safely driving ].

description.body:
When following the route to call line, currently the Officer or Passenger is required to zoom/move the screen to follow the unit. This currently limits them from being able to do other things such as complete donning of bunker gear, review of medical protocols, drive, etc... We utilize the PC App in all of our apparatus to include Fire, Ambulance and Chief Officers. Essentially I'm looking to see if its possible to allow the screen to revert to tracking the logged unit (apparatus) as it proceeds to a incident location. Any information you can provide would be greatly appreciated.

Acceptance Tests:

I can see a button on the map that I intuitively know means centering

When I hit the button, I get a visual cue that it is now enabled

When the button is enabled, the map centers on my location without changing the zoom level

When the button is enabled, as I move the map stays centered on my position

If I drag the map while the button is enabled, the centering turns off and the button shows as disabled

When the button is disabled, the map does not move unless I move it.

data.name: As [ Bryan, the Product Manager ] I want to [ have a single client able to use an AED icon that was not built into the release ], so that I can [ deliver new content to our clients without a full release process ].

description.body:
[ Bryan ] I love the idea of the content delivery system, but the previous stories I built were too bloated and monolithic.  This story aims at keeping all our existing icons exactly how they are, but adding one single new icon through a channel that dos not require a redeploy cycle.  It's a lot of overhead for one icon, but it will tie into future content to have it dynamically adapt inside the apps.

  • When structuring this, we will want to keep in mind there may be multiple content types with different metadata, but those requirements are evolving and fuzzy.
  • This story does not care about how the icon gets loaded in the backend.  Aim for a minimalist design that is not too difficult to update by hand.
  • Security: not needed in first pass, we may want to consider Balrog as an option for this when it is ready, though?

 

Acceptance Tests:

  • I am able to create an AED location
  • I can see that AED location properly from multiple devices on the same build
  • From any other client or an older build of the client we selected, all I see is a default icon (flag or tag, you tell me and be consistent in it's application)
  • Updating from an older version to the new version should allow me to see the AED properly.

data.name: Re-Imagine Webview

description.body:
[ Bryan ] Webview's code is old and patched together with hacks from too many developers that basically made it spaghetti.  We need a clean, minimalistic, modular design for a Webview 2.0.

  • There are near infinite use cases for a display board on the station.  Generally, people care about the features webview provides, but they also have lots of random, one off suggestions that others may or may not use if we built it.  What we want is the ability to allow them to customize the screen as they desire.

 

Design should consider these stories:

  • Modular Dashboard type of Design that scales to fit the size of the screen.
  • A User can see a list of existing plugins somewhere.
  • A User can select which plugins appear on the screen
  • A User can move the plugin around and resize it.
  • At minimum, there will be a map plugin, a directions plugin, and some number of alert plugins (last alert, list all alerts) if you want to conceptualize a few more and sketch those as well.
We need a new, modular webview we can maintain and extend with new tech

tasks.name: This is a larger scope of envisioning work, just want to get you thinking about it.

data.name: As [ Kenneth Ultz, an Active911 Admin ] I want to [ be able to increase or decrease my response options ], so that I can [ custom tailor them to my department ].

description.body:
We need more response buttons, When we were considering Act911 I was told by one of your reps over the phone that this was being worked on. We need a minimum of 8 Customize-able Response Buttons, Adding one more row of 5 would be Great.  


[ Bryan ] from the idea, the general accepted max number they would need is 10.  There are numerous use cases for varying station numbers, custom responses, different responses for apparatus and users, etc.  A good start would be allowing them to define 0 to 10 options and having the clients gracefully handle the adjustments without looking terrible.


Acceptance Tests:

  • As someone with edit permissions on the agency tab, I want to be able to customize my number of response options available to my department from 0 to 10.
  • I'd like to customize each individual response, limited to some character count.
    • Britt, please determine a max size given the client style constraints
  • Inside each client, the number of responses dictate the style of the responses.
    • Zero responses leads to nothing being shown in the alert
    • 2 responses looks like it fits on the page
    • 10 responses looks like it fits on the page
    • How do odd response numbers look compared to even?

We need more response buttons, When we were considering Act911 I was told by one of your reps over the phone that this was being worked on. We need a minimum of 8 Customize-able Response Buttons, Adding one more row of 5 would be Great.

data.name: As [ Britt, a UI/UX reviewer ] I want to [ make drag and drop on Android more intuitive for our users ], so that I can [ make our apps more user friendly ].

description.body:
[ Britt]

From a UX/UI standpoint, the marker does an odd jump when you long press on it. There is nothing that says you are moving around the marker. At first this seems a little odd, but iOS is the same. The difference is that there is a pop up that says “confirm the move?” I think there should be the same pop up window so that the user realizes that they did a move. I don’t think that having the bar that the top is sufficient. I would delete the save button from the top and just have a pop up to confirm the move.

Acceptance Tests:

  • When I drag and drop a marker, I should get a prompt asking me "Confirm the move?" with confirm/cancel options
  • If I hit confirm, the marker should update on my clients and iOS
  • If I hit cancel, the marker should not move and nothing should change on iOS
  • I should not see a bar on the top when a marker moves
  • When I grab a marker, I would like a clearer indicator that I am grabbing a map marker

data.name: As [ Bryan, the Product Manager ] I want to [ make sure the daily parser report emails that are sent to support can survive a death of mcp.active911.com ], so that I can [ give the needed visibility to keep a useful daily email service running ].

description.body:
As [Jon a Tier 3 guy] I want [to see the history of changes to the  activation email script] so that I can [effectively diagnose problems with the activation emails]

As [Jon a devOps guy] I want [the script to be deployable out of a repo and updated automatically] so that I can [deploy changes to it quickly and with confidence]

 

The script currently live in the root directory of mcp.active911.com and has a manually added cronjob which runs it each day.

We need to do 3 things:

1) Figure out a repository the script can live in, an existing one preferably but a new repo as a last resort would be acceptable, and push it to that repo

2) Add to puppet deployment of that script from the repo to mcp.active911.com.  Also add the cronjob to the mcp Puppet recipe

3) Remove the manual cronjob and script from mcp

 

We're going to make activation scripts great again! 

[ Bryan ] I hacked together a script I used for my own purposes as a baby dev to determine what parsers I needed to write vs what parsers I could assign, then trained Support to use it as a tool instead of the clumsy user interface on the website.  I asked about it a few days ago and it is something that has become ingrained in support workflows, so it's in our best interest to make sure devs know it exists.

goals.name: Internal Tools to support automation, agility, and accountability

data.name: As [ Cheryl Bergstrom, and Active911 Admin ], I want to [ save time and effort adding devices to the account ], so that I can [ spend my time focusing on what really matters to my department].

description.body:
import devices from a CSV file.

Lets plan on the first row being a key for all the subsequent values in the column.

Acceptance Tests:

  • I can upload.a csv with a header row.
  • I can see what the header names need to be to be properly interpreted by active911 before I begin
  • I can download a sample that will allow me to have a template to build on.
  • Active911 can interpret those headers to determine where to put the data
  • For each row, if we do not recognize the phone number or email automatically create a device and user.
  • If a phone number or email is already in use, save it for a confirmation step.
  • After all the rows have been processed, give me a list of devices I need to confirm. For each device, I can approve or reject.
  • If I approve a device, it will be created as a multiple use device
  • If I deny a device, it will not be created.

data.name: As [ Ben Woodruff, a chief with vision problems ], I want to [ have iOS use my preferred text size ], so that I can [ safely read the information on my vehicles iPad ].

description.body:
From Ben:

Please support the Dynamic Type accessibility feature of iOS. This has been a feature available in iOS to assist those with vision problems since iOS 7. Technical details are available here: https://useyourloaf.com/blog/supporting-dynamic-type/

The text in the iOS app, particularly on an iPad, is too small to read from any reasonable distance. Particularly the text in the incident list in the left-hand sidebar.

data.name: As [ Tier 3 ] I want to [ productionize our JIRA environment ], so that I can [ back it up and maintain it ].

description.body:
Once we've decided if we are going to continue to host and use JIRA, we should do a couple of productionization steps.

1) Switch to an actual database backend rather than the H2 database it is currently on

2) Cache a frozen copy of the JIRA image in our own registry to use instead of relying on Dockerhub. Build from the source if possible.

2.1) Cache a frozen copy of the simple mailer container we are using to send mail from JIRA

3) Outline deployment, backup, and upgrade strategies, including where the container will live and what URL it will live on.

Acceptance Tests:

I should be able to spool up a new instance of JIRA on a different machine with relative ease

I shouldn't lose more than a few days in the spooling up of a new instance

data.name: As [ a User ] I want to [ read the instructions in the forgot password email to follow a link to a change password view ], so that I can [ create a new password ].

description.body:
Acceptance Tests

  • change password view should load
  • password should meet active911 criteria for characters and length
  • If password does not meet Active911 criteria, return a descriptive error.
  • User needs to doubly enter the password, and they need to match to succeed.
  • If double passwords do not match, return a descriptive error.
  • If password link has expired, view should return descriptive error that the link has expired
  • If password link is unexpired, view should work.

Our password reset is clumsy and unintuitive, leading to a lot of dissatisfaction and contacting support for something that should be simple.  We want to rework and update it using the password reset work Britt has done for us, which is attached.

description.body:
Acceptance Tests

  • forgot password view loads
  • send button should send a reset email when the users email is in the system
  • send button should return an error if the email is not in our system
  • email should contain instructions and a link to a change password view
  • email link expires after 24 hours, not one use

Future Stories may entail expiring the link after the password has been reset.

data.name: Make XMPPD config a templated file

description.body:
[ Jon ]

The Jenkins build for XMPPD has a single config file.

However, XMPPD needs a different xmpp domain for each environment

We need a way for the XMPPD server to be configured at runtime for the environment it is in

As it stands, automatic builds of the XMPPD server cannot just be deployed to any environment, they need to have a config that matches the environment

In the meantime, I am turning off automatic build of XMPPD and requiring manual triggering of builds.


Per conversation with Bryan, freezing it on one config and making it a manual build is not a huge pain point since the service changes so rarely.
